data.title: [Windows] Dragging assets into editor blocks Windows Explorer
data.body: Atomic immediately starts converting assets on drop and doesn't return control to Windows Explorer until conversion is complete, hanging the explorer window.

data.title: Text3D port to Graphics module
data.body:
This PR adds Text3D to the Graphics submodule with support for ttf, bitmap, and sdf (Signed Distance Field) fonts.  It also includes C++/C# FeatureExample ports.

![text3d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376203/27016325-6c0bc968-4ed3-11e7-8d8e-c82acfee94ba.PNG)

Closes #260

data.title: Resizing player window with an empty scene spams "Failed to lock index buffer"
data.body:
Easy repro:
 - Create a new Basic2D project
 - Delete the Star/Spinner
 - Hit Play
 - Resize the window

I encountered this when setting up a pure gui layout and hadn't added any renderable scene objects yet.  Adding a dummy clear sprite works around the issue, but having ~100 log messages per second is a bit inconvenient.

data.title: Adding myself to the contributors list
fix bug setting TB DefaultFont size
data.body: This PR fixes a bug that has been there for awhile. There was a hardcoded 12 where the size argument should have been. Where this becomes important, is when you change the operating DPI (I lie to the TB system, since it lies right back) this bug hardcodes 12 (pixels) into all the default TB widgets as their size, and changing your dpi either way, results in peculiar (in a bad way) UI.

data.title: Updating Examples submodule commit
[C++] Atomic shared library support
data.body:
This PR is a continuation of https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1554 with some fixed to get FeatureExamples linking:

![atomiconthetop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376203/27006752-75333068-4df1-11e7-8c44-450a97ade232.PNG)
, details there.

data.title: [C#] Better handling of inherited interface methods
data.body: Closes #1556

data.title: UIPromptWindow and UIFinderWindow Widgets (Tweaks)
data.body: A continuation of https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1551 with a couple minor tweaks

data.title: [C#] AbstractFile doesn't inherit Deserializer/Serializer interfaces
data.body:
What probably needs to happen is AbstractFile inheriting Serializer/Deserializer interfaces instead of 
collapsing those interfaces into itself at binding generation time.

```public partial class File : AObject, AbstractFile```
```public partial interface AbstractFile```
```public partial interface Deserializer```
```public partial interface Serializer```

data.title: [C#] Issues surrounding Navmesh serialization and async loading
data.body:
I've found several issues trying to work with the navmesh in C# which are semi-related:
1) Atomic doesnt save/load the navmesh in the scene
2) atomic can't async load scenes
3) directly using the urho async load sorta works, but its not useful to solve my navmesh issue because it can't async load the navmesh from the scene file since its never saved into the scene file by atomic.
4) manually loading/saving the navmesh doesnt work either because File can't be cast to Serializable as it should due to inheritance gotchas with the C# bindings
5) even if the manual load/save could work, it would still block because doing it manually doesn't take advantage of the async pattern

data.title: Building engine as shared lib
data.body:
This PR adds `ATOMIC_DYNAMIC_RUNTIME` which enables building engine as shared library. Shared library builds also link to msvc runtime dynamically. By default flag is not enabled and static build is produced just like now.

Also added few warning cleanups and moved some build flags from global scope into Atomic project so that they are pulled in by downstream projects when linking to Atomic. These flags are `-std=gnu++11` and msvc runtime flags.

Tested and works on Linux and Windows. I didnt touch mac part at all (except for `-std=gnu++11`) since i can not test it nor i know what should be done. Tips would be appreciated. I myself am looking at moving compiler and linker flags from `AtomicMac.cmake` to Atomic project build script so they can be automatically inherited by downstream projects as well, but that is when we know that current changes didnt break anything-mac.

data.title: 2d project templates work
data.body:
Added/Improved comments
Made different language versions consistent

data.title: [JavaScript/TypeScript] Generated properties should use corresponding method docs
data.body: Properties in the tsdoc are currently uncommented, and should provide the same comment description of their corresponding methods: http://docs.atomicgameengine.com/api/classes/atomic.graphics.html

data.title: UIPromptWindow and UIFinderWindow Widgets
data.body:
This PR does a couple of things... 
   The UISelectList is given access to the items in the list, and has added calls to be able to create, remove and populate the list items within the class (used in the UIFinderWindow).  The UIFieldEdit can now bring up the onscreen keyboard on mobile platforms to edit strings.
   There are two new widgets, UIPromptWindow and UIFinderWindow, both can be used in C++, C# and JS/TS.  UIPromptWindow is an Atomic widget that can get a string from the user, the result is sent to an event handler. UIFinderWindow is an Atomic widget that can get a file or path from the user, the result is sent to an event handler.  The Finder has the ability to create a directory at the current path, and it uses a UIPromptWindow to get the name.  It can also bookmark directories that the user finds interesting, again using a UIPromptWindow to change the name if the preselected name is not wanted. These bookmarks are saved on device (in the AtomicGameEngine preferences directory) and restored when the Finder is used again.

The UIFinderWindow needs testing on Windows because of the slashes.

data.title: [Atomic2D] TMX File loader doesn't support tilesets with individual images
data.body:
Currently the TMX file loader can load external Tileset files, but only if they contain a single image composing a sprite sheet.  Tiled also support tile sets that are composed of individual images, but the TMX loader can't deal with these.   The loader should be able to identify these two types of tilesets load them correctly.  

A tileset consisting of a spritesheet looks like:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tileset name="ForestObjects" tilewidth="64" tileheight="64">
 <image source="ForestObjects.png" width="128" height="577"/>
 <tile id="8">
  <objectgroup draworder="index">
   <object x="1.67936" y="1.95925" width="60.1769" height="60.4568"/>
  </objectgroup>
 </tile>
</tileset>
```

 A tileset consisting of multiple individual images looks like:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<tileset name="sample_tileset" tilewidth="101" tileheight="171" tilecount="5" columns="0">
 <grid orientation="orthogonal" width="1" height="1"/>
 <tile id="0">
  <image width="101" height="171" source="Character Boy.png"/>
  <objectgroup draworder="index">
   <properties>
    <property name="blueprint" value="hero"/>
   </properties>
  </objectgroup>
 </tile>
</tileset>
```

data.title: Minor fixes for TMX files
data.body:
This PR includes a couple quick fixes
- Latest version of Tiled has a version id of `1.0.0` instead of `1.0` so this recognizes both
- Tiled supports the ability to use individual images in a tileset instead of a spritesheet.  The version of the TMXFile in Urho and Atomic doesn't support this, but also doesn't indicate why loading a tmx with these fails.  This checks for that situation and writes out the appropriate error.

Note: I'll add a new issue to see if it will be possible for the TmxFile loader to support these types of tilesets in the future.

data.title: TS/JS Debugging broken
data.body: It appears that TS/JS debugging is broken.  You are able to pause and step, but breakpoints don't seem to be triggering correctly.

data.title: Check for `/usr/bin/mono/` directory
data.body:
Adds a check for the `/usr/bin/mono/` directory before automatically setting `with-atomicnet=true` - so doesn't build with C# when it shouldn't.

Added a `programDirectoryExists` function for the check

Closes #1544 

Tested on Ubuntu 17.04 - though should be consist on most distros. Mono seems pretty consistently installed to `/usr/bin/mono`

data.title: support for DragonBones pro?
data.body:
I believe that Atomic game engine is better than many other open source game engines except for the fact that you have to pay to buy Spriter (and I believe that breaks the open source freedom concept)
If [dragonbones](http://dragonbones.com/en/index.html) were supported I may seriously move to atomic

data.title: D3d11 deferred rendering broken
data.body:
So far it seem to point toward something broken when using d3d11 in deferred with perpixel lights. (Maybe there's more things broken)

Could be related to recent changes on the way defines are handled for shader d3d11 variations.

To repro that isuue easily just run a sample scene (Water sample, rotating chest sample) in deferred (you might have to either force the editor or the player to run in deferred using Engine.json for example)

data.title: nonet flag isn't applied automatically in all cases - PCL Reference Assemblies not installed
data.body:
The linux build instructions say that
> The --nonet flag will automatically be applied if Visual Studio or mono isn't installed on the system

My build (`sh Build_AtomicEditor.sh`) errors with
`/usr/lib/mono/4.5/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : PCL Reference Assemblies not installed.`

 as mono wasn't installed. 

It seems that it isn't detection that mono isn't installed, and is trying to build with C# features.

* Installing mono ([as detailed](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Detailed-instructions-for-building-on-Linux)) fixed this
* Adding `--nonet` manually also works (after removing mono)

Happy to look more closely if you can direct to where the detection of mono's installation happens

## System details:
Ubuntu 16.10 64 bit

## Logs
[Atomic.log is attached (as .txt)](https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/files/1026615/Atomic.log.txt)

tail of console follows
```
Errors:

(Build target) ->
/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Artifacts/AtomicNET/Build/AtomicNET/AtomicNET.csproj (default targets) ->
/usr/lib/mono/4.5/Microsoft.Common.targets (GetReferenceAssemblyPaths target) ->

	/usr/lib/mono/4.5/Microsoft.Common.targets: error : PCL Reference Assemblies not installed.

	 57 Warning(s)
	 1 Error(s)

Time Elapsed 00:00:01.9028370

Compilation Command: -c mono "/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Build/Managed/nuget/nuget.exe" restore "/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Artifacts/AtomicNET/Build/AtomicNET.sln" && "xbuild" "/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Artifacts/AtomicNET/Build/AtomicNET.sln" /p:Platform="Any CPU" /p:Configuration=Release

NETBuild Error for solution: /home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Script/AtomicNET/AtomicNETProject.json
/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Build/node_modules/jake/lib/api.js:340
        throw errObj;
        ^

Error: Process exited with error.
    at api.fail (/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Build/node_modules/jake/lib/api.js:336:18)
    at Exec.<anonymous> (/home/shearer/code/AtomicGameEngine/Build/node_modules/jake/lib/utils/index.js:124:9)
    at emitTwo (events.js:106:13)
    at Exec.emit (events.js:194:7)
```

data.title: [Scripting] Generate file with list of rejected C++ API signatures
data.body: Generating a file with an organized list of rejected public C++ API signatures, based on unsupported return or parameter types, would be very useful.

data.title: Add UISelectList accessors to get list strings
[Scripting] Setting graphics subsystem mode doesn't work as expected - can't make window resizable
data.body:
I couldn't find a way to make the window resizable after it's created, this call for example:
    `GetSubsystem<Graphics>().SetMode(1280,720,false,false,true,false,false,true,0);`
where I'm passing 'true' for the resizable parameter doesn't make it resizable.
On a related note, you may want to provide SetSize() and SetResizable() or setters to easily manipulate those values. I think that a Size getter or SetSize() for instance is much more intuitive than SetMode() which I guess could be interpreted as the color depth or something, especially since there are Width and Height getters.

data.title: Improve error message when attempting to build out of a local repo
[C#, Linux] Running C# project from editor/monodevelop exception
data.body:
After clean build from github the editor (and monodevelop) will build c# project but won't run.

Instead error is generated:
```
Unhandled Exception:
System.DllNotFoundException: AtomicNETNative.dll
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) AtomicEngine.Time:csb_Atomic_Time_GetClassIDStatic ()
  at AtomicEngine.CoreModule.Initialize () [0x00000] in <2ff57665979c477ca5527ca392dbf0ae>:0 
  at AtomicEngine.AtomicNET.Initialize () [0x00000] in <2ff57665979c477ca5527ca392dbf0ae>:0 
  at AtomicEngine.NETIPCPlayerApp.Create (System.String[] args, System.Boolean headless) [0x00000] in <2ff57665979c477ca5527ca392dbf0ae>:0 
  at AtomicEngine.Application.Run (System.Type appDelegateType, System.String[] args) [0x00002] in <2ff57665979c477ca5527ca392dbf0ae>:0 
  at AtomicEngine.Application.Run[T] (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <2ff57665979c477ca5527ca392dbf0ae>:0 
  at AtomicPlayer.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <047224e5bf8c4006834a84a610f8f531>:0 
```

This is happening on Linux Mint, unsure about other distros. Meo @MJ-meo-dmt is also having the same issue.

data.title: [C#] Enum improvements and access to CSComponentAssembly type information at runtime
data.body: This PR improved enumeration serialization for script fields to be by enum string instead of numeric value.  It also adds a Cache representation of CSComponentAssembly type information which is available at runtime.  If generating the project Cache, and AtomicNETService is not available to process the binary solution, the cached information in the assemblies ```.asset``` file is used.

data.title: [C#, Android] Building editor with Android C# on Windows, adb.exe process hangs stalling build
data.body: When building editor with Android C# support on Windows, adb.exe process hangs stalling build.   Opening TaskManager and killing adb.exe, successfully completes the build
